name: hyphenate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to use a hyphen to join two words or two parts of a word

Related word
hyphenation
someone who has two or more different jobs, especially in the entertainment industry: Of course, MTV didn't invent the singer-actor hyphenate. These writers also took credit as producers, which made them hyphenates. See also
multi-hyphenate
More examplesFewer examplesThis artist-musician-actor and all-round hyphenate had always had a fear of flying.Many of the workers are what he calls "hyphenates". They're bartender-actors, waitress-musicians, or any other conceivable combination. Show runners are "hyphenates," a hybrid of starry-eyed artists and tough-as-nails operational managers.
